msg: Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository

First pass for implementing column visibility. GridColumn's visible property works now except when toggling at run time. I've also changed the way we determine a column's width. Now, we first look at the explicit width, then the typical width, and finally, the default width of 150.
-Added two internal methods that calculate the next and previous column.visible==true column index.
-Modified the loops to loop through column.visible==true columns instead of all the columns.
-Fixed getColumnWidth() and other methods to fall back on the typical cell width.
-The methods will now skip columns with a typical cell width of 0 (meaning they are column.visible==false).
-Modified updateDisplayList to only create renderers for the column.visible==true columns.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository

Fix variableRowHeight support in GridDimensions and other various bugs. These changes also fix Grid to follow the correct measure rules such as rowHeight having a real effect on the typical row height.
Grid.as - The rowHeight is now backed by GridDimensions.defaultRowHeight now. Moved some clearing code down to commitProperties.

GridDimensions.as - Removed fixedRowHeight. Instead, we use a variableRowHeight Boolean that reflects the Grid’s value. The defaultRowHeight returns Grid’s rowHeight if rowHeight is explicitly set. If rowHeight isn’t set, defaultRowHeight returns the maximum typical cell height. defaultRowHeight also defaults to NaN now instead of 26.
GridLayout.as - Fixed an RTE from getItemRendererAt() in the case that bounds is null. Removed some excess code.
GridColumn.as - Fixed an edge case which was causing an RTE where someone sets the dataField to null.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Fix for handling columns (IList) changes in GridDimensions. I implemented the columnsCollectionChanged handler in GridDimensions to handle all the collection events.

GridDimensions.as - When someone sets the columnCount, we should clear everything. Implemented columnsCollectionChanged(). Changed typicalCellWidths and typicalCellHeights to Vectors to make them easier to handle. Added a few helper functions to insert multiple values into vectors and to clear a vector. Also, fixed a small bug in getColumnIndexAt for the case where the column width is 0. Fixed up the rowCount setter to remove the excess rows.
Grid.as - Move setting columnCount from clearGridLayoutCache to commitProperties because it should only be set when the columns actually change. Add call to columnsCollectionChanged.
GridRowList.as, GridRowNode.as - Add support for column changes.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
CHB and DataGrid - remove unnecessay code
DataGroup - fix RTE in removeRendererAt which can happen if the renderer has already been recycled

Grid - fix interaction of generatedColumns with typicalItem and/or dataProvider changing, fix interaction of variableRowHeight and rowHeight, selection methods need to force validation before they can be done since pending dataProvider or column changes will reset the selection, update CHB when dp changes
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Fixes and some code clean up for DataGrid. These fix issues with how the DataGrid looks when different indicators and separators are null. It also improves the look when the dataProvider is cleared.

GridLayout.as - Fix bug in layoutLinearElements() where we were allowing null values to stay in newVisibleElements. We should shorten the vector instead. Also, I fixed layoutSelectionIndicators() and layoutIndicator() to remove previously cached indicators when the factory is null. Lastly, fixed up layoutRow/ColumnSeparator to return the correct bounds when no item renderer exists. This is used in the case that we clear the dataProvider.
GridDimensions.as - Fix getPadRowBounds() so that it only never uses a negative index when calling getCellX and getColumnWidth.
DataGrid.as - use Grid's clearGridLayoutCache instead of manually clearing the caches.
